database.confirmPurge: Are you sure you want to purge old data according to the configured retention? This action cannot be undone.
database.confirmPurgeHistory: Are you sure you want to purge history according to the configured retention? This action cannot be undone.
database.confirmPurgeScans: Are you sure you want to purge scans according to the configured retention? This action cannot be undone.
database.confirmPurgeOffline: Are you sure you want to purge offline IPs according to the configured retention? This action cannot be undone.
database.confirmPurgeAll: ⚠️ WARNING: Do you really want to delete ALL network scan data (history + scans + latency measurements) regardless of retention? This action cannot be undone.
database.confirmOptimize: Optimizing the database may take a moment. Continue?
database.purgeSuccess: Purge complete: {{total}} entries deleted (History: {{history}}, Scans: {{scans}}, Offline: {{offline}}, Latency: {{latency}})
database.purgeAllSuccess: All data deleted: {{scans}} scans, {{history}} history, {{offline}} offline, {{latency}} latency measurements (Total: {{total}}){{ipsKept}}
database.retentionHistoryDesc: Number of days to keep in scan history (network_scan_history)
database.retentionScansDesc: Number of days to keep scan entries (network_scans)
database.retentionOfflineDesc: Number of days to keep offline IPs (faster cleanup)
database.retentionLatencyDesc: Number of days to keep latency measurements (latency_measurements)
database.keepIpsOnPurgeDesc: Keep scanned IPs even after purge to monitor actual total network IP count
database.purgeScheduleDesc: Cron expression for schedule (e.g. '0 2 * * *' = daily at 2am)
database.warningIrreversible: These actions are irreversible. Make sure you have backed up your data if needed.
database.optimizeDesc: Database optimization (VACUUM + index optimization + stats refresh)
database.noteIpsKept: ⚠️ Note: Deletes network scan data only. IPs will be kept ("Keep IPs" option enabled).
database.perfDockerDesc: Enable optimizations for Docker (automatic WAL checkpoint every 5 min)
database.walAutoCheckpointDesc: Enable automatic WAL checkpoint (recommended for Docker)
database.cacheSizeDesc: SQLite cache in KB (negative = KB, positive = pages). Default: -64000 (64 MB)

admin.debugIntro: This section groups useful information for debugging MynetworK: logs, external configuration and technical metrics.
admin.debugConfigFile: config/mynetwork.conf if mounted, import/export via Exporter section.
admin.freeboxBackupDesc: Freebox allows exporting and importing its configuration via the native web interface.
admin.backupIntro: It is difficult to create automatic backups via this application for network equipment (Freebox, UniFi Controller). These devices' APIs do not provide official endpoints to trigger configuration exports in an automated way.
admin.backupRecommendationText: Remember to perform regular manual backups of your network equipment configurations via the native web interfaces. The links below let you access the backup pages directly.
admin.freeboxBackupFirmwareNote: This feature is available from Freebox OS firmware version 4.5.3.
admin.freeboxBackupExportNote: The export contains part of your Freebox Server configuration. Import requires a Freebox Server reboot.
admin.freeboxNotRegistered: Freebox is not registered. Please connect first.
admin.unifiBackupDesc: The UniFi controller allows you to create configuration backups via the web interface. Backups include controller settings, sites, and network configuration.
admin.unifiBackupNote: Go to the "Maintenance" or "Settings" section of your UniFi controller to create and download configuration backups.
admin.unifiNotConfigured: UniFi plugin is not configured. Configure it in the Plugins tab.
admin.backupInfoFreeboxSuffix: files that contain part of your Freebox Server configuration. Store these files in a safe place.
admin.backupInfoUnifi: UniFi backups can be created from the controller web interface. See UniFi documentation for more information on restoring backups.
admin.aboutDescription: MynetworK is a multi-source dashboard for managing your local network. The app integrates with Freebox (Freebox OS), UniFi Controller and other systems. It displays real-time traffic, device status, VMs, downloads, call history and more. Deployable via Docker with authentication and user management. For installation, configuration and full documentation, see the project README on GitHub.
admin.projectDescription: Multi-source dashboard for managing your network. Integration with Freebox, UniFi Controller and other network systems.

general.unsavedChangesHint: You have modified the public URL. Do not forget to click "Save" to save your changes.
general.publicUrlEmptyHint: Leave empty to use local IP or default values

profile.mustBeLoggedIn: You must be logged in to update your profile
profile.usernameMinLength: Username must be at least 3 characters
profile.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters
profile.serverUnreachable: Unable to reach the server. Make sure the backend server is running.
profile.fileConvertError: Unable to convert file to base64
profile.imageTooLarge: Image is too large after conversion
profile.networkError: Unable to reach the server. Check your network connection.

updateCheck.autoCheckDescription: Enable checking for new versions on GitHub Container Registry
updateCheck.updateAvailableHint: An update is available. To update, use:
updateCheck.manualCheckDisabled: Manual update check is temporarily disabled.

freeboxFirmwareCheck.autoCheckDescription: Periodically check dev.freebox.fr/blog for new Server and Player firmware versions

users.timeoutError: Request timed out. Please try again.
users.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this user?

plugins.freeboxPermissionRequired: The "{{permission}}" permission is required to access some Freebox features (RRD history, extended stats, etc.).
plugins.stepGoToSettings: Go to Settings → Access management → Applications

logs.confirmClearAll: Are you sure you want to delete all logs? This action cannot be undone.
logs.clearSuccess: All logs have been deleted ({{count}} entries)

security.subtitle: Security and authentication settings
security.corsSaveSuccess: CORS configuration saved. A server restart is required to apply changes.
security.unsavedChangesHint: You have modified settings. Do not forget to click "Save" to apply your changes.
security.jwtDefaultDesc: For security reasons, set an environment variable
security.jwtProductionHint: In production, use a strong randomly generated secret (at least 32 characters).
security.maxLoginAttemptsDesc: Number of login attempts allowed before automatic lockout
security.lockoutDurationDesc: Duration of lockout after exceeding maximum attempts
security.trackingWindowDesc: Period over which failed attempts are counted
security.protectionActiveDesc: Failed login attempts are automatically blocked after {{max}} attempts for {{duration}} minutes.
security.sessionTimeoutDesc: Time before user session expires (applies to new logins only)
security.sessionWarning: Note: The new expiration delay will only apply to new sessions. Active sessions will keep their original expiration.
security.sessionStorageHintPrefix: Configuration is stored in the database and overrides the
security.rateLimitDesc: Limit requests per IP to prevent DDoS attacks
security.blockedListDesc: List of IP addresses and usernames currently blocked due to failed login attempts
security.blockedListHint: Only actively blocked IPs/accounts are shown. Blocks are temporary (configurable duration) and in-memory: a server restart clears the list. An empty list is normal when no block is currently active.
security.noBlocked: No IP or account currently blocked
security.corsIntroTitle: CORS configuration for proxy and external access
security.corsIntroDesc: Configure allowed origins, HTTP methods and headers to avoid CORS errors with local proxies or external access.
security.allowedOriginsDesc: List of domains/IPs allowed to access the API. Use * to allow all origins (not recommended in production).
security.allowedOriginsVsPublicUrl: Different from « Public URL (Domain) » (General): here you define which origins the browser may use to call the API (CORS). Public URL is the single base address where the app is served.
security.noOriginsConfigured: No origin configured. Default values will be used.
security.corsDefaultsDesc: Defaults: in production (Docker), all origins are allowed; in development, localhost:3000, localhost:5173, 192.168.x.x:3000/5173, and 127.0.0.1 with any port.
security.allowCredentialsDesc: Allow sending cookies and auth headers in cross-origin requests
security.allowedMethodsDesc: HTTP methods allowed for cross-origin requests
security.allowedHeadersDesc: HTTP headers allowed in cross-origin requests

debug.clearTitle: Clear memory: removes all logs from in-memory buffer (max 1000 logs). Useful to free memory after debugging.
debug.confirmClear:
Do you really want to clear memory?

This will remove all logs from the in-memory buffer (max 1000 logs). This action cannot be undone.
debug.useRefreshToLoad: Use the "Refresh" button to load logs
debug.warningManyLogs: Displaying {{count}} logs. This may affect browser performance.
debug.debugLogsDesc: Enable debug log output in server console (detailed operation information)
debug.verboseLogsDesc: Enable very detailed logs (verbose) - requires debug mode to be enabled
debug.debugDisabledMsg: Debug logs are disabled. Enable them to see operation details in server logs.
debug.debugEnabledMsg: Debug logs are enabled. Server logs will show more detailed information.

exporter.influxTestSuccess: InfluxDB export successful! Metrics are available.
exporter.unsavedHint: You have modified the metrics configuration. Do not forget to click "Save configuration" to apply your changes.
exporter.prometheusEnableDesc: Expose metrics in Prometheus format at /api/metrics/prometheus
exporter.serverPortDesc: Change if needed. Used for Prometheus metrics URL.
exporter.endpointUrlDesc: Full URL to fetch Prometheus metrics
exporter.prometheusNote: The configured port ({{port}}) is the actual backend server port. The endpoint is available at
exporter.influxdbEnableDesc: Export metrics in InfluxDB Line Protocol format
exporter.influxdbNote: InfluxDB export is available via endpoint
exporter.exportConfigDesc: Download the full application configuration (plugins, settings) as .conf file
exporter.importConfigDesc: Import configuration from a .conf file (replaces current configuration)
